title: Bookmark separators (and more?) acting obnoxiously in v91.0
content:
I use separators in a lot of my bookmarks displayed on the bookmark toolbar. After allowing the upgrade to v91 (a big mistake as it's been nothing but a disruption to my work), I find removing separators to be finicky compared to older versions. FYI - in case it matters, I was using the [preferred] NOT BLACK background of 'classic' Firefox in all prior versions.

A quick right click at the separate was enough to bring up the context menu with DELETE command. Now, it can take multiple attempts to get just the right spot for this to work. It seems the separate went from multiple pixels thick to just a single pixel. Whatever the tech explanation, it sucks.

Also, I noticed that trying to add a separator to a sub-list of bookmarks, by another separator, apparently keeps focus on the main dropdown list since the separator ends up there rather than on the sub-list I clicked. I don't do this often so I can't say it never occurred before. Putting a separator between bookmarks seems ok.

Am I crazy and just noticing these things now that the dreaded black background is in full effect? Can these "improvements" be negated so working in Firefox is actually easy again? Can the black menu background be taken back to the classic look (without fooling around with custom coding as I've seen mentioned in other help issues?)
creator: jonbarden

title: Autoname Images when file already existing
content:

I just migrated back to Firefox from the new Chromium Edge Brower because many functions didn't work properly anymore like CAPTCHA and so on. I don't know if there is already a function that I just oversaw but if anyone can help, I would be very grateful for that.

title: Lost Sound
content: Lost sound on my speakers on FireFox IMMEDIATELY after installing 3 updates on my Win 10 Pro computers with 1. Latest Version of Net Framework All computers lost sound on FireFox: 1. I have sound on my computer for everything except FireFox 2. I have sound on MS Edge & Chrome 3. Sound is not X'ed out on the browser tabs 4. Sound is not blocked on the "Bock Audio & Video" on the URL 5. Sound is not X'ed out "Speakers" icon in the system tray 6. Windows Sound Trouble Shooter did not fix it. 7. Windows System > Sound > Advanced sound options shows Mozilla Firefox set to "Default" - slider is at 50% 9. Hard Boot failed to restore sound to Firefox (that worked in the past) 10. Reinstalled FireFox NONE OF THE ABOVE ACTIONS HAVE RESTORED SOUND TO FIREFOX!

title: Firefox backup became an Edge file when imported to new computer
content:
I have a large number of carefully organized Firefox bookmarks, which I backed up each time I logged off for the day, saving the most recent five. I imported these from my standalone backup hard drive to my new computer. Firefox couldn't restore them. Then I saw that for all five files, the listed file type was "Microsoft Edge HTML Document," so no wonder.

I have no idea how or why this happened or what to do about it. In theory, import into Edge and then export into Firefox? Given this incident and some bad past experiences, that prospect scares me to death. Any other suggestions, please? I would be so grateful for a way out of this.
creator: vckanter

title: Pages rendering with only text and very sparse images
content:
I'm on a Macbook and suddenly Firefox is no longer displaying pages fully. It seems to only grab text and styling and a few seemingly-arbitary but consistent images. I've uploaded an example image from trying to view forums.somethingawful.com. This started last night when I was trying to close some other apps with CMD+Q but they lagged and I ended up closing a bunch and I thought I had accidentally mashed some other CMD+key combo that put me in some funky render mode.

Chrome on this laptop works fine. Firefox on my PC logged in to the same Mozilla account still works.

I've tried: - Restarting my laptop - All the steps in this document: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/websites-look-wrong-or-appear-differently - Creating a new Firefox local profile through about:profiles - Ensured View > Page Style > Basic Page Style is checked - Deleting the Firefox and Mozilla folders in Caches, deleting Firefox from Applications, and reinstalling

I'm now on a blank install with zero add-ons or extensions, but it's still not displaying correctly. Any help would be greatly appreciated!

content:
I've been wanting to write for years about all the almost daily updates of FIREFOX that cannot be necessary! If I do not see a decline in the updates within a short period, I will remove FIREFOX from all my devices and use only CHROME. It is getting more and more frequent that I must use Chrome anyway or not be able to access the intended website.

Also, you removed the Gmail option from your home page and I must jump through hoops to get to gmail. If I check gmail 5 times a day, I must go through 6-7 steps to log in each time and it get very tedious. With Chrome, I click gmail and voila, I'm there. No signing in, password, and captcha.

FIREFOX is beginning to be too much of a burden. Either stop your obtrusive updates. give me an easy sign with Gmail, and make Firefox a browser with which I access ALL sites or I will just stop using FF altogether.

p.s. I am not alone. Many, many friends and family have already cut the cords with FF and I'm next. (not that you care, I'm sure)

title: File Fragments
content: I am hoping someone from Firefox Development sees this and that something can be done for those of us who need to have several tabs open simultaneously. I often find myself engaged in research that for convenience requires that I have several tabs open which eventually leads to browser slow down, hanging, and sometimes a crash. Im convinced this is the correct analysis since defragging the ssd fixes it every time. I believe it would be very helpful if Firefox were to add a compressor to its file storage routine, first blush thoughts, possibly one compressed file per tab. When I get into heavy research I find myself defragging sometimes several times in a day, which temporarily fixes the problem. Any chance this can be added, or if anyone knows of a fix to this issue? rgds, j

title: Firefox sometimes doesn't launch
content:
Firefox usually launches OK, but about a third of the time, it just doesn't launch at all. I can see the program running in the Task Manager, but the profile manager never appears (as it normally would) and nothing happens. If I end the Firefox process and relaunch it, it still never launches. Only a restart seems to fix it.

This has been happening for a few months now, usually when my computer has been on for a while. My system has been a little slow lately and I might have thought it was a system problem, however, Firefox is the only program that seems to have any problem launching.

I don't know if it's related, but Firefox has also been very slow connecting to websites lately, with the connection often dropping out for maybe 5 minutes at a time. I know there's nothing wrong with my actual connection because all other internet-based applications work fine and never slow down.

Firefox 91, Windows 7 x64

title: Firefox displays blank pages
content:
Hello all,

Although I have just updated Firefox to the last version hoping that the problem might be solved, after using the browser for a while and I google searching something, I get a blank page that does not load. Accessing other websites (bookmarked pages) might work sometimes though, but accessing the home page (google, google translate) just displays a blank page, no error message. I have started Mozilla in safe mode (troubleshooting mode) and the problem persists.

I have already deleted cookies, created a new profile, and reinstalled Mozilla and nothing seemed to work. The behavior is rather unpredictable and odd as I could not identify a pattern for the instances it happens. Exiting the browser and restarting it seems to solve the problem for the moment and then the behavior reoccurs. Also, sometimes after getting blank pages, taking a break or just using other browsers the problem is solved by itself temporarily. This does not happen when accessing Microsoft Edge.

title: Double spacing in Menus is back  :'-(
content:
A few months ago Firefox decided to double space all the items in menus. Reading through the forums many people didn't like this because of the amount of space that the menus now take up. Fortunately there was a work around, by setting 'browser.proton.contextmenus.enabled to false they returned to normal

This morning Firefox my got upgraded and the double spacing problem is back again. However there appears to be a bug with the setting and the menus won't return to normal. I'm now stuck with stupidly large menus that won't fit on the screen and lots of painful scrolling.

Does anybody have an alternative workaround until this is fixed?

creator: mr.sutugin

title: Menu item spacing
content:
Hi there! Since FF 91 all menu items have an incredible vertical spacing, the menu item is twice as high as before. This is a nuisance especially in the bookmark menus. I would like to have the narrow menu item spacing back, without being urged to install an AddOn or to learn CSS programming or to file a bug in this peculiar BugZilla system. Think of our family of USERS, not developers.

Yes, I understand the circumstances of free software. Yes, I see it is necessary to keep up with modern UI design and the so-called technical progress. The FF 91 UI changes slightly towards what we expect to get in Windows 11. Fine! Also, it is absolutely clear that the new menu line spacing adds more comfort to the FF usability ... on tablet PCs and smart phones. But NOT for desktop users.

As far as I know, Microsofts plans for Windows 11 still include a setting to keep the old narrow menu item height. Mozilla should do so, too. I hope the developers will take care to not lose contact to their users.
creator: Semilynx

title: Firefox window is completely inaccessible after Alt + tab
content:
Using Alt + tab on an open Firefox browser window, minimizes the window and is completely inaccessible from the taskbar, as well as the task manager. I can only view options to end the task and other standard options n the Firefox processes which are running (in the background).

For example, if audio is playing from a tab in the current Firefox session, and I alt tab it, there is no way to restore this minimized Firefox window. There is also no visual highlight on the Firefox icon in the taskbar that, one window is currently in session. it looks like there are no open Firefox windows. Shift right clicking on the Firefox icon only shows the standard menu (as in the case where you have not yet opened Firefox), instead of showing options such as maximize, restore etc.

Since there is no way to return to my session which is still active, I have to go to task manager, end all Firefox tasks and reopen the application. Please help!
creator: sriram.pcm

title: 申请找回火狐浏览器历史书签记录
content: 我用了11年的火狐浏览器，每次重装系统，第一个装的就是火狐浏览器，然后设为默认浏览器，把系统自带的浏览器打入冷宫； 11年的书签，11年的拓展，11年的积极推荐，在今年一次重置密码之后，荡然无存... 如果在我第一次重置密码的时候，知道重置会导致这些内容丢失，我会早就放弃使用火狐。 为什么以前重置密码没有发生丢失，为什么要在重置密码的时候告知用户“可能会丢失”，丢就是丢，可能是什么意思，不稳定？ 用户心理角度来想，一个不去维护书签和组件的人， 对于浏览器品牌来说，就是一个不稳定的用户。所以对他来说，重置密码会影响书签和拓展丢失并没有什么意义；而一个善于维护标签的用户，必然是这个浏览器的忠实粉丝，而你们就是这么对这批用户的？ ———————————————————————— 我不知道你们还有没有以前的日志，还能能不能找到我以前的书签和拓展记录，如果有，看在11年的粉丝份上，可以帮我找回吗？

title: Blank backgrounds and black fonts
content:
See the attached pics. They are both of the same Mozilla support webpage - one on Firefox and one on Safari. The one on Safari looks the way that I would expect it to but Firefox shows it without background colours. On other websites I have noticed that where there are grey fonts on Safari, Firefox shows those fonts all black.

I first noticed this starting about one week ago but I can't remember anything specific changing around that time but I may have forgotten (age!). I have tried troubleshooting mode and refreshing the browser and I have even created a new profile but the problem persists. It is like this on all websites that I have accessed.

title: Can't set any preferences
content:
Since the 91 update, I can't configure any preferences in Firefox. The boxes are there, but I can't check them. The only way I know if they've been checked is to see how Firefox behaves! Surely this is some kind of bug???

Portions of the Settings panel cannot be set:

General, Search, Privacy & Security - anything that has a box to be checked or unchecked, I cannot check. I therefore do not know ANY of my settings! Please help!


Also, when I pull up the settings page, once I leave the page, I have to pull it back up again - it doesn't stay but reverts back to the new tab page. Most annoying.

Surely this cannot be correct!

title: Firefox 91 tabs.
content:
So, I just got the new firefox update, v91 I think? and the tabs are absolutely driving me insane. I can't quite find how to fix it.

Last time, I had the proton tabs disabled and that was pretty much all I needed to fix the issue. But right now I've got two problems: 1. I really dislike the floating look to them, is there any way to again block the proton update/feel etc? 2. This is the one that's truly got me bananas: the volume icon that one usually got in the tab by default when sound was being reproduced... now only shows when the cursor hovers above it, otherwise it disappears. Is there any way to bring this function back?

Please, please help.

I adore Firefox, have been using it pretty much since 2004 or thereabouts, and would not change it... but sometimes these changes drive me to tears. I'd love it if there was a manual or something that would teach one how to change these things without having to bother anyone else :(

Thank you guys!!
creator: silfer_cartagena

title: Microphone won't pick up audio
content:
as of today Im having issues with Firefox recording any audio from my headset. I have confirmed that its firefox causing the issues. I did a system update, firefox updated, my drivers are up to date, other programs pick up0 the audio such as OBS Studio, Discord, Chrome online audio tests work. When I try the same audio tests on Firefox, it doesnt work at all, it pickups that I have my mic plugged in but when it comes to record, it doesnt record any sound. I also did a restart of Firefox. Any help would be appreciated.

https://bin.snopyta.org/?603bddd490784b2f#6wm4BfpkyTJLiH9mrAfY65r4RNAimWHFXgUCcneucooT

HyperX Cloud Alpha Mic is what I have the mic labeled as.

EDIT: Ive tried using other mics and uninstalling Firefox/removing all traces of FF from the pc. FF is still the only program that refuses to access any mic. Everything else uses the mic without issue. I've also tried installing older versions of Firefox and still have the same result.
